#Name	Type (tree, msa)	Command	Output_filname
# Variable names that can be used:
# INPUT : The full path of the input filename (fasta file of sequences for and msa method, multiple sequence alignment fasta file for tree method)
# BASENAME : Just the filename without the directory path (a number of methods use this to name the output file automatically, see MergeAlign command for an example)
# OUTPUT : the user specified output filename without any directory path
# IDENTIFIER : A name generated by OrthoFinder to uniquely identify the orthogroup (a number of methods use this to name the output file automatically, see RAxML command for an example)  
# - : Indicates that the field is not being specified by the user (e.g. for the Output_filename field in the configuration file)
# TRUE : True
# FALSE	: False

# Alignment Methods
mafft	msa	mafft --localpair --maxiterate 1000 --anysymbol INPUT > OUTPUT 2> /dev/null
mergealign	msa	python /home/david/software/MergeAlign/run_mergealign.py INPUT	PATH/MergeAlign_alignment_BASENAME

false_method	tree	wont_run	

# Tree Methods
fasttree	tree	FastTree INPUT > OUTPUT 2> /dev/null
iqtree	tree	/home/david/software/iqtree-1.5.3-Linux/bin/iqtree -s INPUT -pre PATH/IDENTIFIER > /dev/null	PATH/IDENTIFIER.treefile
raxml_no_path	tree	/usr/local/bin/raxmlHPC-AVX -m PROTGAMMALG -p 12345 -s INPUT -n IDENTIFIER	PATH/RAxML_bestTree_IDENTIFIER

bad_method	msa	which
